intro: Argostemma calcicola, commonly known as the limestone argostemma, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in rocky or calcareous soils, often growing in crevices or on limestone outcrops. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
